results.title: Trading
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Twelve of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Correcting
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program follows the trial of Nie Chengying, accused of stealing from her neighbour, to show the legal system at work in China. The legal system not only aims to punish and protect society, but also seeks to restore the social harmony which has been disturbed by the crime. Also explores the social pressures at work in the new consumer society which may cause a person to commit a crime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Living
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
Over four fifths of China’s 1000 million inhabitants are peasants. This program visits a rural village to discover how they live. We follow the day to day life of a village family and focuses on the local Party secretary to depict the organisation of the village as a whole and the brigade and commune of which it is a part.

results.title: Rembrandt: draughtsman
results.creator_credit: Kees van Langeraad, Tina De Vrij, Hans Nieman, Rijksmuseum Amsterdam and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting
results.brief_description: The paintings of Dutch 17th century painter Rembrandt van Rijn, are world famous, but a large number of his beautiful drawings have never been seen by the public. This film explores this rich oeuvre, setting it in the context of Rembrandt’s life, his work, his contemporaries and the society of 17th century Holland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kees van Langeraad, Tina De Vrij, Hans Nieman, Rijksmuseum Amsterdam and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting

results.title: Rembetika: The Blues of Greece
results.creator_credit: Philippe de Montignie, Zelda Rosenbaum, Video Images Australia and DNM Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Anthony Quinn, “Rembetika: The blues of Greece” is the story of the music made popular by the film, “Zorba the Greek”. This video was filmed in Greece, Turkey, America and Australia, and traces the history of this ‘blues’ music of Greece from its origins in the hashish dens of Athens and Smyrna. It includes rare footage of some of the most famous names in Rembetika such as, Mikis Theodorakis, Markos Vamvakaris, Sotiria Bellou, Mariza Koch and Vasilis Tsitsanis. There is even rarer footage of the 1921 invasion of Turkey, by Greece, which led to the greatest disaster in Greek history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philippe de Montignie, Zelda Rosenbaum, Video Images Australia and DNM Productions

results.title: Reflections: Ireland
results.creator_credit: Patrick Carey, John Spencer, Grania O'Shannon and Viscom Productions
results.brief_description: This beautiful atmospheric film shows various aspects of an Irish landscape, which is particularly emphasised by rivers, wind and sea. Interesting use of sounds, eg birds chirping, water flowing and the use of traditional Irish folk music played by Paddy Moloney and the Chieftains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Carey, John Spencer, Grania O’Shannon and Viscom Productions

results.title: Inja = Dog
results.creator_credit: Joe Weatherstone, Steve Pasvolsky and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
South Africa, 1980s. Using a young Xhosa boy as a pawn, a farmer teaches his puppy to be white man’s best friend. Ten years later, both their lives hang in the balance at the mercy of the dog.
Filmed on location at Bien Donne Werf, Franschhoek Valley, South Africa.
In English/Afrikaans/Xhosa with English subtitles

results.title: Relax it's just sex [DVD]
results.creator_credit: P.J. Castellaneta, Harold Warren, Megan O'Neill, Steven J Wolfe, Sneak Preview Entertainment, Forefront Films and Millivres Multimedia
results.brief_description: Relax its just sex is about a group of twenty/thirty-something friends - a mix of straight, lesbian, bi-sexual and homosexual - sorting through the complexities of their relationships with various lovers and friends. Tara (Jennifer Tilly) is the mother hen of the group who keeps them all together; Vincey is the only single one and longs for a partner; Sarina and Megan break up when Megan sleeps with a man; Robin is their friend who helps Sarina out. On the whole the film has a comic tone - the opening sequence cautions the audience that when it comes to homosexuality there is nothing to be afraid of. Nevertheless, the film soon turns tragic as it delves into issues such as AIDS and gay bashing. Characters frequently address the camera, explaining their inner thoughts and feelings about their current situation as well as musing on the nature of love and sex. With at least ten principal characters, some are not given enough screen time to develop beyond caricature and at times the film is stagnated by its talkiness. Despite these flaws however, “Relax its just sex” is by turns amusing, thought provoking and quite sexy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: P.J. Castellaneta, Harold Warren, Megan O’Neill, Steven J Wolfe, Sneak Preview Entertainment, Forefront Films and Millivres Multimedia

results.title: Relationships and stress
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper, Time-Life Video & Television and Tapper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
One part of a series of six programs which looks at the major problems faced by Joan Robinson, who is dying of cancer. This episode shows ways of handling the changing relationships with family, friends and medical personnel. Experts talk to the viewer about how serious illness can materially change relationships and how people can cope with the emotions and strains that inevitably follow diagnosis of a serious illness. Narrated by Meryl Streep.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David A. Tapper, Time-Life Video & Television and Tapper Productions
